content.en: So I said to myself, you know, nobody's ever going to know unless I run, because I'm really proud of my success.
content.zh: 所以我对自己说，除非我参选，否则没人会知道，因为我真的为自己的成功感到自豪。

from.en: Announcement speech (June 2015)
from.zh: 宣布参选演讲（2015年6月）

content.en: The Obama Administration's agreement with Iran is very dangerous. Iran developing a nuclear weapon, either through uranium or nuclear fuel, and defying the world is still a very real possibility. The inspections will not be followed, and Iran will no longer have any sanctions. Iran gets everything and loses nothing. Every promise the Obama Administration made in the beginning of negotiations, including the vow (made at the beginning of the negotiations) to get our great American prisoners returned to the U. S. has been broken. This is a bad deal that sets a dangerous precedent. This deal sets off a nuclear arms race in the Middle East, which is the most-unstable region in the world. It is a horrible and perhaps catastrophic event for Israel. Furthermore, we should have kept the billions of dollars we have agreed to pay them. Any great dealmaker would know this is a perfect example of "tapping along" and because they have been unchecked for so long throughout this extremely lengthy process, I guarantee they are much closer to producing a nuclear weapon than they were at the start of negotiations. The fact is, the US has incompetent leaders and even more incompetent negotiators. We must do better for America and the world. We have to Make America Great Again.
content.zh: 奥巴马政府与伊朗达成的协议非常危险。伊朗研制核武器（无论是通过铀还是核燃料）并藐视世界，仍然是非常现实的可能性。核查将不会得到遵守，伊朗也将不再受到任何制裁。伊朗将获得一切，却一无所失。奥巴马政府在谈判之初做出的所有承诺，包括将我们伟大的美国战俘遣返回美国的誓言（在谈判之初做出），都已被违背。这是一项糟糕的协议，开创了一个危险的先例。这项协议在中东——世界上最不稳定的地区——引发了核军备竞赛。这对以色列来说是一件可怕的、甚至可能是灾难性的事件。此外，我们本应保留我们同意支付给他们的数十亿美元。任何一位伟大的交易撮合者都知道，这是一个“偷偷摸摸”的完美例子，而且由于他们在整个极其漫长的谈判过程中长期未受到制约，我敢保证，他们现在比谈判之初更接近制造核武器。事实是，美国的领导人无能，谈判代表更是无能。我们必须为美国和世界做得更好。我们必须让美国再次伟大。

from.en: Statement by Donald J. Trump on the Iran Agreement, American Presidency Project, 14 July 2015
from.zh: 唐纳德·J·特朗普关于伊朗协议的声明，美国总统项目，2015年7月14日

content.en: You're going to have a deportation force, and you're going to do it humanely and you're going to bring the country -- and, frankly, the people, because you have some excellent, wonderful people, some fantastic people hat have been here for a long period of time. Don't forget, Mika, that you have millions of people that are waiting in line to come into this country and they're waiting to come in legally. And I always say the wall, we're going to build the wall. It's going to be a real deal. It's going to be a real wall. There was a picture in one of the magazines where they had a wall this tall and they were taking drugs over the wall. They built a ramp over the wall and the truck was going up and down. They were using it like a highway; the wall is like a highway. It's not going to happen. It's going to be a Trump wall. It's going to be a real wall. And it's going to stop people and it's going to be good. But your friend Thomas Friedman called me and said, hah, there should be a big door. I said going to be a big door. I love the expression. There's going to be a big beautiful nice door. People are going to come in and they're going to come in legally. But we have no choice. Otherwise, we don't have a country. We don't even know how many people. We don't know if it's 8 million or if it's 20 million. We have no idea how many people are in our country. And then you see what happened with Kate in San Francisco. You see what happens with all of the things going on, all of the tremendous crime going on. It costs us $200 billion a year for illegal immigration right now. $200 billion a year, maybe $250, maybe $300. They don't even know. We're going to stop it. We're going to run it properly and we're going to stop it.
content.zh: 你们将组建一支驱逐出境部队，你们将以人道的方式执行，你们将带领这个国家——坦白说，还有你们的人民，因为你们有一些非常优秀、非常了不起的人，一些在这里生活了很长时间的了不起的人。米卡，别忘了，你们有数百万人在排队等待进入这个国家，他们在等待合法入境。我总是说要建墙，我们要建墙。这将是一项真正的工程。这将是一堵真正的墙。曾经有杂志上刊登过一张照片，照片上他们建了一堵这么高的墙，人们正在翻墙偷毒品。他们在墙上建了一个坡道，卡车可以上下行驶。他们把它当作高速公路；这堵墙就像高速公路一样。这不会发生。这将是一堵特朗普式的墙。这将是一堵真正的墙。它将阻止人们，这将是好事。但你的朋友托马斯·弗里德曼打电话给我说，哈哈，应该有一扇大门。我说要有一扇大门。我喜欢这个说法。要有一扇又大又漂亮又漂亮的大门。人们会进来，而且要合法进来。但我们别无选择。否则，我们就没有国家了。我们甚至不知道有多少人。我们不知道是800万还是2000万。我们根本不知道我们国家到底有多少人。然后你看看凯特在旧金山的遭遇。你看看所有正在发生的事情，所有正在发生的骇人听闻的犯罪。现在非法移民每年给我们造成2000亿美元的损失。每年2000亿美元，也许是2.5亿美元，也许是3亿美元。他们甚至都不知道。我们要阻止它。我们要妥善管理，我们要阻止它。

from.en: On his immigration plan (2015 November 11)
from.zh: 关于他的移民计划（2015年11月11日）

content.en: This is a movement. It is a movement going on. We want to take our country back. Our country is disappearing. You look at the kind of deals we make. You look at what's happening, our country is going in the wrong direction, and so wrong, and it's got to be stopped and it's got to be stopped fast.
content.zh: 这是一场运动。一场正在进行的运动。我们要夺回我们的国家。我们的国家正在消失。看看我们做的那些交易。看看正在发生的事情，我们的国家正朝着错误的方向前进，错得离谱，必须被阻止，必须迅速被阻止。

from.en: Presidential Candidate Donald Trump at Liberty University, C-SPAN (18 January 2016)
from.zh: 总统候选人唐纳德·特朗普在自由大学，C-SPAN（2016年1月18日）

content.en: We're a debtor nation. We owe $19 trillion. We're not going to give you any money, and you want to be nice. You don't want to put it in their face. Just say, look, we're a poor nation. We've been mismanaged, we've been misrun. We don't know what the hell we're doing, right?
content.zh: 我们是一个债务国。我们欠了19万亿美元。我们不会给你们任何钱，你们也想表现得友善些，不想当面批评他们。就说，看，我们是一个穷国。我们管理不善，运作失当。我们根本不知道自己在干什么，对吧？

from.en: Presidential Candidate Donald Trump at Liberty University, C-SPAN (18 January 2016)
from.zh: 总统候选人唐纳德·特朗普在自由大学讲话，C-SPAN（2016年1月18日）

content.en: This has been going if it's not going to happen anymore, folks. We're going to bring businesses back. We're going to have businesses that used to be in New Hampshire, that are now in Mexico, come back to New Hampshire and you can tell them to go f--- themselves...because they let you down, and they left. We want the businesses that stay. I know a lot of businesses up here and I knew a lot of businesses up here. These are great people, they could've left and they wanna stay. They willing to stay, they're fighting to stay. It's hard. With a highest tax nation in the entire world. It's hard for them to stay and they stay. Those are the people we have to cherish and love. These are the people that are great.
content.zh: 伙计们，这种情况一直在发生，如果不再发生的话。我们要让企业回归。我们要让那些曾经在新罕布什尔州、现在在墨西哥的企业回归新罕布什尔州，你可以让他们滚蛋……因为他们让你们失望了，所以他们离开了。我们希望企业留下来。我认识这里很多企业，也认识这里很多企业。他们都是很棒的人，他们本可以离开，但他们想留下来。他们愿意留下来，他们正在为留下来而奋斗。这很难。美国是世界上税率最高的国家。对他们来说，留下来很难，但他们还是留下来了。这些人是我们必须珍惜和爱戴的人。这些人是伟大的人。

from.en: At a rally in New Hampshire. (4 February 2016)
from.zh: 在新罕布什尔州的一次集会上。（2016年2月4日）

content.en: Iran has already, since the deal is in place, test-fired ballistic missiles three times. Those ballistic missiles, with a range of 1,250 miles, were designed to intimidate not only Israel, which is only 600 miles away, but also intended to frighten Europe and someday maybe hit even the United States. And we're not going to let that happen. We're not letting it happen. And we're not letting it happen to Israel, believe me. Thank you. Thank you. Do you want to hear something really shocking? As many of the great people in this room know, painted on those missiles in both Hebrew and Farsi were the words "Israel must be wiped off the face of the earth." You can forget that. What kind of demented minds write that in Hebrew?
content.zh: 自协议达成以来，伊朗已经三次试射弹道导弹。这些射程达1250英里（约2000公里）的弹道导弹，其设计目的不仅在于恐吓距离仅600英里（约964公里）的以色列，也是为了恐吓欧洲，甚至有朝一日甚至可能袭击美国。我们绝不会让这种事情发生。我们绝不会让这种事情发生。相信我，我们绝不会让这种事情发生在以色列身上。 谢谢。谢谢。 你们想听一些真正令人震惊的事情吗？正如在座的许多杰出人士所知，这些导弹上用希伯来语和波斯语写着“以色列必须从地球上抹去”。你们还是别提这事儿了。 是什么样的疯子会用希伯来语写出这些话？

from.en: 21 March 2016 address to AIPAC (America-Israel Public Affairs Committee)
from.zh: 2016年3月21日，在美以公共事务委员会（AIPAC）的讲话

content.en: The decision to overthrow the regime in Libya, then pushing for the overthrow of the regime in Syria, among other things, without plans for the day after, have created space for ISIS to expand and grow like nobody has ever seen before. These actions, along with our disastrous Iran deal, have also reduced our ability to work in partnership with our Muslim allies in the region. That is why our new goal must be to defeat Islamic terrorism not nation building. No more nation building. It's never going to work.
content.zh: 推翻利比亚政权的决定，以及随后推动推翻叙利亚政权等一系列行动，都缺乏后续计划，为ISIS提供了前所未有的扩张和发展空间。这些行动，加上我们灾难性的伊朗协议，也削弱了我们与该地区穆斯林盟友合作的能力。正因如此，我们的新目标必须是击败伊斯兰恐怖主义，而不是国家建设。不再进行国家建设。这永远不会奏效。

from.en: Speech after the 2016 Orlando nightclub shooting (transcript)
from.zh: 2016年奥兰多夜总会枪击案后讲话（文字记录）

content.en: Look, having nuclear—my uncle was a great professor and scientist and engineer, Dr. John Trump at MIT; good genes, very good genes, OK, very smart, the Wharton School of Finance, very good, very smart—you know, if you're a conservative Republican, if I were a liberal, if, like, OK, if I ran as a liberal Democrat, they would say I'm one of the smartest people anywhere in the world—it's true!—but when you're a conservative Republican they try—oh, do they do a number—that's why I always start off: Went to Wharton, was a good student, went there, went there, did this, built a fortune—you know I have to give my like credentials all the time, because we're a little disadvantaged—but you look at the nuclear deal, the thing that really bothers me—it would have been so easy, and it's not as important as these lives are—nuclear is powerful; my uncle explained that to me many, many years ago, the power and that was 35 years ago; he would explain the power of what's going to happen and he was right, who would have thought?—but when you look at what's going on with the four prisoners—now it used to be three, now it's four—but when it was three and even now, I would have said it's all in the messenger; fellas, and it is fellas because, you know, they don't, they haven't figured that the women are smarter right now than the men, so, you know, it's gonna take them about another 150 years—but the Persians are great negotiators, the Iranians are great negotiators, so, and they, they just killed, they just killed us.
content.zh: 你看，拥有核能——我的叔叔是一位伟大的教授、科学家和工程师，麻省理工学院的约翰·特朗普博士；良好的基因，非常好的基因，好吧，非常聪明，沃顿商学院，非常好，非常聪明——你知道，如果你是一个保守的共和党人，如果我是一个自由主义者，如果，比如，好吧，如果我以自由民主党人的身份参选，他们会说我是世界上最聪明的人之一——这是真的！——但是当你是一个保守的共和党人时，他们会尝试——哦，他们会做一个数字——这就是为什么我总是这样开头：上过沃顿商学院，是个好学生，去过那里，去过那里，做过这件事，积累了财富——你知道我必须一直提供我的资历，因为我们有点处于劣势——但你看看核协议，真正让我困扰的事情——这本来很容易，而且它并不像这些生命那么重要——核能是强大的；我叔叔很多年前就向我解释过核能的力量，那是 35 年前的事了；他会解释即将发生的事情的威力，他是对的，谁会想到呢？——但当你看看那四名囚犯的遭遇——以前是三名，现在是四名——但以前是三名，甚至现在，我会说一切都取决于信使；伙计们，因为，你知道，他们没有，他们没有意识到现在的女人比男人更聪明，所以，你知道，他们还需要大约150年——但波斯人是伟大的谈判者，伊朗人是伟大的谈判者，所以，他们，他们杀了我们，他们杀了我们。

from.en: Speech in South Carolina (19 July 2016)
from.zh: 南卡罗来纳州演讲（2016年7月19日）

content.en: $400 million in all cash, anybody know what that looks like? That's a lot of cash. That's a lot of case. And honestly, it's so sad. Think of it, going to Iran, a terrorist state. Now I happen to think they have plenty of money, we've given then $150 billion, so the $400 million is just, you know – I happen to think it goes into their accounts in Switzerland personally. Now, a lot of people say, "no, no, it's used for terror," and they use it for terror because it's the number one terror funder – not even close. But I also think that when you have $400 million in cash, different denominations, do you see the size of this? I guess they did release the pictures after all. They released pictures. ... Obama said that he did it because we don't have a working account with Iran. Do you believe that? How long does it take to set up an account? Right? You don't have a working account, you set up an account, right?
content.zh: 4亿美元现金，有人知道这笔钱是多少吗？这可是一大笔钱，案子也不少。说实话，这真是太可悲了。想想看，要去伊朗，一个恐怖主义国家。我碰巧觉得他们钱多着呢，我们已经给了他们1500亿美元，所以这4亿美元，你知道——我碰巧觉得这笔钱是存入了他们在瑞士的私人账户的。现在很多人说：“不，不，这笔钱是用来做恐怖主义的了。”他们把这笔钱用来做恐怖主义，因为伊朗是头号恐怖主义资助者——甚至都排不上号。但我也认为，当你拥有4亿美元现金，各种面额的现金时，你能想象这笔钱的规模吗？我猜他们毕竟公布了照片。他们公布了照片……奥巴马说他这么做是因为我们与伊朗没有一个可用的账户。你相信吗？开立一个账户需要多长时间？对吧？你没有一个能用的账户，你注册了一个账户，对吧？

from.en: Speech at rally in Wilmington, North Carolina. Transcript (August 9, 2016)
from.zh: 北卡罗来纳州威尔明顿集会演讲。文字记录（2016年8月9日）

content.en: We get Bergdahl who was a traitor, and they get five of the greatest killers that they've wanted for eight years. We get Bergdahl — I call it the five for one trade. For the Iran deal, where we get nothing, we get nothing. They get ultimately, they have the path, beautiful path, they'll get way, way earlier than that. They'll get nuclear weapons, so if you get Trump you're going to see a lot of changes to that deal. That'll happen fast.
content.zh: 我们抓到了叛徒伯格达尔，他们抓到了他们八年来一直通缉的五个最厉害的杀手。我们抓到了伯格达尔——我称之为“五换一”交易。至于伊朗协议，我们什么都没得到，我们什么都没得到。他们最终得到了，他们有一条路，一条美丽的路，他们会比这更快、更早得到。他们会得到核武器，所以如果特朗普上台，你就会看到这项协议发生很多变化。这会很快发生。

from.en: Speech at rally in Wilmington, North Carolina. Transcript (August 9, 2016)
from.zh: 北卡罗来纳州威尔明顿集会演讲。文字记录（2016年8月9日）

content.en: America first. We get a little tired of these deals where they actually put, and you know why, because of lobbyists and special interests and people representing and people wanting it to happen. It's just not that they want other countries to benefit over us. There are reasons for it and you know, when I raise money, and I'm putting up a lot of money for my own campaign, I'm funding me. And I'm raising for the Republican party. And we're getting a lot of money from the small donors.
content.zh: 美国优先。我们对他们实际上达成的这些交易感到有些厌倦，原因在于游说团体、特殊利益集团、代表人士以及那些希望这种情况发生的人。他们并非希望其他国家从我们身上获益。这样做是有原因的，你知道，当我筹款时，我为自己的竞选活动投入了大量资金，这笔钱本身就是在资助我自己。我为共和党筹款。我们也从小额捐款者那里获得了大量资金。

from.en: Speech at rally in Wilmington, North Carolina. Transcript (August 9, 2016)
from.zh: 北卡罗来纳州威尔明顿集会演讲。文字记录（2016年8月9日）

content.en: Obama-Clinton economic policies have produced 1.2 percent economic growth, the weakest so-called recovery since the Great Depression. Now, this is, like, unbelievable — 1.2. Do you know China goes to 7 percent or 8 percent, it's like a national catastrophe. Now, what they do is they cut their currency. They devalue their currency, and big league, and then all of our businesses continue to be drained out of the United States. Our money, our jobs. They make our product, they sell our product to us. No tax, no nothing, you devalue — see devaluing is sort of cheating.
content.zh: 奥巴马-克林顿的经济政策带来了1.2%的经济增长，这是自大萧条以来最弱的所谓复苏。现在，这简直令人难以置信——1.2%。你知道吗，中国的经济增长率竟然高达7%或8%，这简直就像一场国家灾难。现在，他们所做的就是削减货币，让他们的货币贬值，等等等等，然后我们所有的企业都源源不断地从美国流失。我们的钱，我们的工作。他们生产我们的产品，然后把我们的产品卖给我们。没有税收，什么都没有，他们就贬值——你看，贬值有点像作弊。

from.en: Speech at rally in Wilmington, North Carolina. Transcript (August 9, 2016)
from.zh: 北卡罗来纳州威尔明顿集会演讲。文字记录（2016年8月9日）

content.en: We have great people. We have the most loyal people. We have the smartest people. You know, so many of my people, they're so smart. They like to say, well, Trump, I don't know if he's got this right — let me tell you, we have the smartest people. We have the people that are the smartest, and the strongest, and the best and the hardest working. We have the smartest people. We'll put I.Q.s among — some of us, we couldn't say all of us, right — against any I.Q.s that we — we have to deal with, that I can tell you. I would love to do that.
content.zh: 我们拥有优秀的人才。我们拥有最忠诚的人才。我们拥有最聪明的人才。你知道，我的很多员工都非常聪明。他们喜欢说，好吧，特朗普，我不知道他是否理解正确——让我告诉你，我们拥有最聪明的人才。我们拥有最聪明、最强大、最优秀、最勤奋的人才。我们拥有最聪明的人才。我们可以把我们中的一些人，而不是所有人，的智商与我们必须应对的任何智商进行比较，我可以告诉你，我很乐意这样做。

from.en: Speech at rally in Wilmington, North Carolina. Transcript (August 9, 2016)
from.zh: 北卡罗来纳州威尔明顿集会演讲。文字记录（2016年8月9日）

content.en: Our movement is about replacing a failed and corrupt - and when I say corrupt, I'm talking about totally corrupt - political establishment [Obamacare] with a new government controlled by you, the American people. There is nothing the political establishment will not do. No lie that they won't tell to hold their prestige and power at your expense and that's what's been happening. The Washington establishment and the financial and media corporations that funded exist for only one reason: to protect and enrich itself. The establishment has trillions of dollars at stake in this election. As an example, just one single trade deal they'd like to pass involves trillions of dollars controlled by many countries, corporations, and lobbyists. For those who controlled the levels of power in Washington, and for the global special interests, they partner with these people that don't have your good in mind. Our campaign represents a true existential threat like they haven't seen before.
content.zh: 我们的运动旨在用一个由你们——美国人民——控制的新政府取代一个失败且腐败的————我所说的腐败，指的是彻底腐败的——政治建制（奥巴马医改）。政治建制无所不能。他们为了维护自己的威望和权力，不惜以牺牲你们的利益为代价，无所不用其极，而这正是目前正在发生的事情。华盛顿建制派以及为其提供资金的金融和媒体公司存在的唯一目的就是：自保和敛财。建制派在这次选举中牵涉到数万亿美元的利益。例如，他们想要通过的一项贸易协议就涉及数万亿美元的资金，而这些资金被许多国家、公司和游说团体控制。那些掌控华盛顿权力的人，以及全球特殊利益集团，他们与这些不为你们好意的人合作。我们的竞选活动代表着他们前所未见的真正生存威胁。

from.en: At a campaign rally in Florida (13 October 2016)
from.zh: 佛罗里达州的一场竞选集会（2016年10月13日）

content.en: No, no, lot of things are going on folks, lot of things. I think she's actually getting pumped up, if you want to know the truth, she's getting pumped up, you understand? In fact we're going to be talking about that in a few minutes. She's getting pumped up for Wednesday night. Let's see. You know, I don't know, maybe, we're like athletes, right? Hey, look, I beat seventeen senators, governors, I beat all these people, we're like athletes. Hillary beat Bernie, although it looks like Bernie got a little bit of a bad deal based on Wikileaks, right? If you look at Wikileaks. But we're like athletes, right? So athletes, they're making them more and more, but athletes, they make them take a drug test, right? I think we should take a drug test prior to the debate, I do. I think we should, why don't we do that? We should take a drug test, prior, because I don't know what's going on with her. But at the beginning of her last debate, she was all pumped up at the beginning, and at the end it was like, "Uh, take me down." She could barely reach her car. So I think we should take a drug test, I'm, er, anyway I'm willing to do it.
content.zh: 不不不，各位，很多事情正在发生，很多事情。我觉得她现在很亢奋，如果你想知道真相，她确实很亢奋，明白吗？事实上，我们几分钟后就会谈到这个。她正在为周三晚上的选举做准备。让我想想。你知道，我不知道，也许，我们就像运动员，对吧？嘿，你看，我打败了17位参议员、州长，我打败了所有这些人，我们就像运动员。希拉里打败了伯尼，虽然根据维基解密，伯尼似乎受到了一些不利的待遇，对吧？如果你看看维基解密的话。但我们就像运动员，对吧？所以，他们越来越多地要求运动员接受药检，但是他们要求运动员接受药检，对吧？我认为我们应该在辩论前进行药检，我同意。我认为我们应该，为什么不这样做呢？我们应该事先做个药检，因为我不知道她到底怎么了。但她上次辩论一开始就很亢奋，最后却像是在说：“呃，把我放下来。” 她几乎够不到自己的车了。所以我觉得我们应该做个药检，我，呃，反正我愿意做。

from.en: At a rally in Portsmouth, New Hampshire, about his rival Hillary Clinton's performance during the presidential debates (15 October 2016)
from.zh: 在新罕布什尔州朴茨茅斯举行的集会上，他谈论了对手希拉里·克林顿在总统辩论中的表现（2016年10月15日）

content.en: Our movement is about replacing a failed and corrupt political establishment with a new government controlled by you, the American people. The establishment has trillions of dollars at stake in this election. For those who control the levers of power in Washington and for the global special interests, they partner with these people that don't have your good in mind. The political establishment that is trying to stop us is the same group responsible for our disastrous trade deals, massive illegal immigration and economic and foreign policies that have bled our country dry. The political establishment has brought about the destruction of our factories and our jobs as they flee to Mexico, China and other countries all around the world. It's a global power structure that is responsible for the economic decisions that have robbed our working class, stripped our country of its wealth and put that money into the pockets of a handful of large corporations and political entities. The only thing that can stop this corrupt machine is you. The only force strong enough to save our country is us. The only people brave enough to vote out this corrupt establishment is you, the American people. I'm doing this for the people and the movement and we will take back this country for you and we will make America great again. I'm Donald Trump and I approve this message.
content.zh: 我们的运动旨在用由你们——美国人民——控制的新政府取代失败腐败的政治建制。这场选举事关建制数万亿美元的利益。那些掌控华盛顿权力杠杆的人以及全球特殊利益集团，与那些不为你们好意的人为伍。试图阻止我们的政治建制，正是那些对我们灾难性的贸易协定、大规模非法移民以及榨干我们国家的经济和外交政策负有责任的群体。政治建制摧毁了我们的工厂和工作岗位，它们流向了墨西哥、中国和世界其他国家。正是这个全球权力结构，制定了那些掠夺我们工人阶级、掠夺我们国家财富并将这些财富塞进少数大公司和政治实体口袋的经济决策。唯一能阻止这台腐败机器的，是你们。唯一强大到足以拯救我们国家的力量，是我们自己。唯一有勇气投票推翻这个腐败建制的人，是你们——美国人民。我这样做是为了人民，为了这场运动，我们将为你们夺回这个国家，我们将让美国再次伟大。我是唐纳德·特朗普，我赞同这句话。

from.en: Closing argument for America (4 November 2016)    Lines recycled from Trump's campaign rally in West Palm Beach, FL (10/13/2016)
from.zh: 美国闭幕词（2016年11月4日） 摘自特朗普在佛罗里达州西棕榈滩的竞选集会（2016年10月13日）

content.en: Today, I would like to provide the American people with an update on the White House transition and our policy plans for the first 100 days. Our transition team is working very smoothly, efficiently, and effectively. Truly great and talented men and women, patriots indeed are being brought in and many will soon be a part of our government, helping us to Make America Great Again. My agenda will be based on a simple core principle: putting America First. Whether it's producing steel, building cars, or curing disease, I want the next generation of production and innovation to happen right here, in our great homeland: America – creating wealth and jobs for American workers. As part of this plan, I've asked my transition team to develop a list of executive actions we can take on day one to restore our laws and bring back our jobs. It's about time. These include the following: On trade, I am going to issue our notification of intent to withdraw from the Trans-Pacific Partnership, a potential disaster for our country. Instead, we will negotiate fair, bilateral trade deals that bring jobs and industry back onto American shores. On energy, I will cancel job-killing restrictions on the production of American energy – including shale energy and clean coal – creating many millions of high-paying jobs. That's what we want, that's what we've been waiting for. On regulation, I will formulate a rule which says that for every one new regulation, two old regulations must be eliminated, it's so important. On national security, I will ask the Department of Defense and the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff to develop a comprehensive plan to protect America's vital infrastructure from cyber-attacks, and all other form of attacks. On immigration, I will direct the Department of Labor to investigate all abuses of visa programs that undercut the American worker. On ethics reform, as part of our plan to Drain the Swamp, we will impose a five-year ban on executive officials becoming lobbyists after they leave the Administration – and a lifetime ban on executive officials lobbying on behalf of a foreign government. These are just a few of the steps we will take to reform Washington and rebuild our middle class. I will provide more updates in the coming days, as we work together to Make America Great Again for everyone.
content.zh: 今天，我想向美国人民通报白宫过渡的最新情况以及我们上任后第一个百日的政策计划。我们的过渡团队工作非常顺利、高效且卓有成效。真正伟大且才华横溢的男男女女，以及爱国者们正在加入政府，其中许多人很快将成为我们政府的一员，帮助我们让美国再次伟大。我的议程将基于一个简单的核心原则：美国优先。无论是生产钢铁、制造汽车还是治愈疾病，我都希望下一代生产和创新能够在这里，在我们伟大的祖国——美国——发生——为美国工人创造财富和就业机会。作为这项计划的一部分，我已要求我的过渡团队制定一份行政措施清单，以便在第一天就可以采取这些措施，以恢复我们的法律并恢复我们的就业机会。现在是时候了。这些措施包括：在贸易方面，我将发布退出《跨太平洋伙伴关系协定》（TPP）的意向通知，这对我们国家来说可能是一场灾难。相反，我们将谈判公平的双边贸易协定，将就业和产业带回美国。在能源方面，我将取消对美国能源生产（包括页岩能源和清洁煤炭）的扼杀就业的限制，从而创造数百万个高薪工作岗位。这正是我们想要的，也是我们一直期盼的。在监管方面，我将制定一项规则，规定每出台一项新法规，就必须废除两项旧法规，这非常重要。在国家安全方面，我将要求国防部和参谋长联席会议主席制定一项全面计划，以保护美国重要基础设施免受网络攻击以及所有其他形式的攻击。在移民方面，我将指示劳工部调查所有滥用签证计划、损害美国工人利益的行为。在道德改革方面，作为我们“抽干沼泽”计划的一部分，我们将对离任后的行政官员实施五年内不得从事游说活动的规定，并终身禁止其代表外国政府进行游说活动。这些只是我们将采取的改革华盛顿和重建中产阶级的措施中的一小部分。我将在未来几天提供更多最新消息，我们将携手努力，让美国再次伟大，造福所有人。

from.en: A Message from President-Elect Donald J. Trump (21 November 2016)
from.zh: 当选总统唐纳德·J·特朗普的致辞（2016年11月21日）

content.en: The old expression, ‘to the victor belong the spoils’—you remember. I always used to say, keep the oil. I wasn’t a fan of Iraq. I didn’t want to go into Iraq. But I will tell you, when we were in, we got out wrong. And I always said, in addition to that, keep the oil. Now, I said it for economic reasons. But if you think about it, Mike, if we kept the oil you probably wouldn’t have ISIS because that’s where they made their money in the first place. So we should have kept the oil. But okay. Maybe you’ll have another chance. But the fact is, should have kept the oil.
content.zh: 有句老话叫“胜者为王，败者为寇”，你还记得吗？我以前总说，保住石油。我本来就不喜欢伊拉克，也不想去伊拉克。但我要告诉你，我们进去之后，撤退时就犯了错误。而且我一直说，除此之外，还要保住石油。我这么说是出于经济原因。但迈克，你想想，如果我们保住了石油，可能就不会有ISIS了，因为他们的钱本来就在那里赚。所以我们应该保住石油。好吧，也许以后还会有机会。但事实是，我们应该保住石油。

from.en: Speech to the CIA, 23 January 2017
from.zh: 2017年1月23日，对中情局的讲话

content.en: You came by the tens of millions to become part of a historic movement the likes of which the world has never seen before. At the center of this movement is a crucial conviction: that a nation exists to serve its citizens. Americans want great schools for their children, safe neighborhoods for their families, and good jobs for themselves. These are just and reasonable demands of righteous people and a righteous public. But for too many of our citizens, a different reality exists: Mothers and children trapped in poverty in our inner cities; rusted-out factories scattered like tombstones across the landscape of our Nation; an education system, flush with cash, but which leaves our young and beautiful students deprived of all knowledge; and the crime and the gangs and the drugs that have stolen too many lives and robbed our country of so much unrealized potential. This American carnage stops right here and stops right now. We are one Nation, and their pain is our pain, their dreams are our dreams, and their success will be our success. We share one heart, one home, and one glorious destiny. The oath of office I take today is an oath of allegiance to all Americans.
content.zh: 你们千百万人齐聚一堂，参与这场史无前例的历史性运动。这场运动的核心是一个至关重要的信念：国家是为了服务其公民而存在的。美国人渴望为子女提供优质的学校，为家人提供安全的社区，为自己提供良好的工作。这些都是正义的民众和正义的公众的正当合理诉求。然而，对于我们太多的公民来说，现实却截然不同：母亲和儿童深陷贫困，生活在内城区；锈迹斑斑的工厂像墓碑一样遍布全国；教育体系资金充裕，却剥夺了我们年轻貌美的学生的一切知识；犯罪、帮派和毒品夺走了太多生命，也剥夺了我们国家如此多未实现的潜力。这场美国式的屠杀就此结束，就在此刻。我们是一个国家，他们的痛苦就是我们的痛苦，他们的梦想就是我们的梦想，他们的成功也将是我们的成功。我们同心同德，同舟共济，拥有同一个辉煌的命运。我今天的就职宣誓，是向全体美国人民效忠的宣誓。

from.en: Inaugural address, (January 20, 2017)
from.zh: 就职演说，（2017年1月20日）

content.en: For us here in Washington, we must never ever stop asking God for the wisdom to serve the public according to His will. But we had tremendous success on The Apprentice and, when I ran for President, I had to leave the show, that's when I knew for sure I was doing it, and they hired a big, big movie star, Arnold Schwarzenegger, to take my place, and we know how that turned out. The ratings went right down the tubes, it's been a total disaster, and Mark [Burnett] will never, ever bet against Trump again, and I want to just pray for Arnold, if we can, for those rating, OK?
content.zh: 对于我们华盛顿人来说，我们永远都不能停止祈求上帝赐予我们智慧，让我们能够按照祂的旨意服务公众。但我们在《学徒》节目中取得了巨大的成功，当我竞选总统时，我不得不离开这个节目，那时我才确定自己要竞选总统，他们聘请了一位超级巨星阿诺德·施瓦辛格来接替我，结果我们都知道。收视率直线下降，简直是一场灾难，马克·伯内特再也不会和特朗普对赌了。如果可以的话，我只想为阿诺德祈祷，为收视率祈祷，好吗？

from.en: Trump's "National Prayer Breakfast" speech (2 February 2017)
from.zh: 特朗普“全国祈祷早餐会”演讲（2017年2月2日）

content.en: Who is the state senator? Do you want to give me his name? We'll destroy his career.
content.zh: 州参议员是谁？你敢告诉我他的名字吗？我们会毁了他的前程。

from.en: Trump responding to Sheriff Harold Eavenson's statement about a Texas state senator proposing legislation to require convictions before sheriffs could receive forfeiture money. (7 February 2017)
from.zh: 特朗普回应哈罗德·伊文森警长关于德克萨斯州参议员提议立法，要求警长在收到没收款项前必须先定罪的声明。（2017年2月7日）

content.en: I love all people, rich or poor, but in those particular positions I just don't want a poor person. We're thinking about building the wall as a solar wall, so it creates energy, and pays for itself. And this way Mexico will have to pay much less money, and that's good, right, is that good? You're the first group I've told that to, a solar wall, makes sense, let's see, we're working it out, we'll see, solar wall, panels, beautiful. I mean actually think of it, the higher it goes the more valuable it is, it's like... pretty good imagination [points to his own head], right, good? My idea.
content.zh: 我爱所有人，无论贫富，但我就是不想让穷人处于那些特定的位置。 我们考虑把墙建成太阳能墙，这样它就能产生能量，自己收回成本。这样墨西哥就不用付那么多钱了，这很好，对吧，是吧？你们是第一个我跟你们提这个建议的人，太阳能墙，很有道理，我们拭目以待，我们正在研究，到时候再看吧，太阳能墙，电池板，真漂亮。我的意思是，想想看，越高越值钱，这就像……相当不错的想象力[指着自己的头]，对吧，好吗？我的主意。

from.en: President Trump Holds a Rally in Cedar Rapids, Iowa (21 June 2017)
from.zh: 特朗普总统在爱荷华州锡达拉皮兹举行集会（2017年6月21日）

content.en: They're starting to, as we gain the remainder, the final remainder of the caliphate of the area, they'll be going to our base in Iraq, and ultimately some will be coming home. But we're going to be there and we're going to be staying-- We have to protect Israel. We have to protect other things that we have. But we're- yeah, they'll be coming back in a matter of time. Look, we're protecting the world. We're spending more money than anybody's ever spent in history, by a lot. We spent, over the last five years, close to 50 billion dollars a year in Afghanistan. That's more than most countries spend for everything including education, medical, and everything else, other than a few countries.
content.zh: 随着我们占领该地区剩余的、最后剩下的哈里发国，他们会开始前往我们在伊拉克的基地，最终有些人会回国。但我们会留在那里，我们会留下来——我们必须保护以色列。我们必须保护我们拥有的其他东西。但是，是的，他们很快就会回来。你看，我们正在保护世界。我们花的钱比历史上任何人都多，多得多。在过去五年里，我们每年在阿富汗的支出接近500亿美元。除了少数国家外，这比大多数国家在教育、医疗和其他所有方面的支出都要多。

from.en: 1 February 2019 broadcast 3 February 2019
from.zh: 2019年2月1日 2019年2月3日播出

content.en: there will be some people in the room that don't like this. We're down to 3.7 percent unemployment — the lowest number in a long time. But think of this: I got all these companies moving in. They need workers. We have to bring people into our country to work these great plants that are opening up all over the place. This was not necessarily what I was saying during the campaign because I never knew we would be as successful as we've been. Companies are roaring back into our country, and now we want people to come in. We need workers to come in, but they've got to come in legally, and they've got to come in through merit, merit, merit.
content.zh: 在座的各位肯定会有人对此表示不满。我们的失业率已经降到了3.7%，这是长期以来的最低水平。但想想看：我让所有这些公司都搬进来了。他们需要工人。我们必须把人们引进我们国家，去这些遍布各地的优秀工厂工作。这并非我在竞选期间所说的，因为我从未想过我们会取得如此大的成功。现在，各家公司正蜂拥而至地回到我们国家，现在我们希望人们进来。我们需要工人进来，但他们必须合法入境，而且必须凭借自身的才能、才能、还是才能。

from.en: 3 March 2019

content.en: I think a lot of progress was made yesterday, but we have to make a lot of progress. Mexico has been making, for many, many years, hundreds of billions of dollars. And then, they've been making an absolute fortune on the United States. They have to step up, and they have to step up to the plate, and perhaps they will. We're going to see. They can solve the problem. The Democrats—Congress has been a disaster. They won't change. They won't do anything. They want free immigration—immigration to pour into our country. They don't care who it is. They don't care what kind of a record they have. It doesn't make any difference. They're not going to be changing anything. We go to them, we say, "Let's fix the immigration laws." They just want it to do badly. The worse it does, the happier they are. So that's the way it is, and I guess that's the way it will be until after the election. It's just a disgrace. Because, frankly, we could solve this problem so easy if the Democrats in Congress were willing to make some changes, but they're not. And that's the way it is. They want to just ride it out. They want to have a real bad time. They don't care about crime. They don't care about drugs pouring into our country. They couldn't care less. It's all politics. It's a vicious business. So that's the way it is. But we're having a great talk with Mexico. We'll see what happens. But something pretty dramatic could happen. We've told Mexico the tariffs go on. And I mean it too. And I'm very happy with it. And lot of people, Senators included, they have no idea what they're talking about when it comes to tariffs. They have no—absolutely no idea. When you have the money, when you have the product, when you have the thing that everybody wants, you're in a position to do very well with tariffs, and that's where we are. We're the piggybank. The United States is the piggybank. It has all the money that others want to take from us, but they're not taking it so easy anymore. It's a lot different. Our talks with China—a lot of interesting things are happening. We'll see what happens.
content.zh: 我认为昨天已经取得了很大进展，但我们必须取得更大的进展。墨西哥多年来赚了数千亿美元。然后，他们又在美国赚取了巨额财富。他们必须站出来，必须承担责任，也许他们会的。我们拭目以待。他们可以解决这个问题。民主党——国会一直是个灾难。他们不会改变。他们什么也不会做。他们想要自由移民——让移民涌入我们的国家。他们不在乎移民是谁。他们不在乎移民的记录如何。这根本无关紧要。他们不会改变任何事情。我们去找他们，说：“让我们修改移民法。”他们只想让移民法变得糟糕。情况越糟，他们就越高兴。所以情况就是这样，我想在选举结束之前都会如此。这简直是耻辱。坦白说，如果国会民主党人愿意做出一些改变，我们就能轻而易举地解决这个问题，但他们却不愿意。情况就是这样。他们只想侥幸逃脱。他们想过得更糟。他们不在乎犯罪。他们不在乎毒品涌入我们国家。他们一点也不在乎。这都是政治。这是一门恶性交易。所以情况就是这样。但我们正在与墨西哥进行良好的谈判。我们会看看会发生什么。但可能会发生一些相当戏剧性的事情。我们已经告诉墨西哥，关税将继续生效。我是认真的。我对此非常满意。很多人，包括参议员，在谈到关税时，根本不知道他们在说什么。他们完全不知道。当你有钱，有产品，有每个人都想要的东西时，你就有能力很好地利用关税，而我们现在就是这样。我们是存钱罐。美国也是。它拥有别人想从我们这里拿走的所有钱，但他们现在不会再轻易得手了。情况大不相同。我们与中国的谈判——很多有趣的事情正在发生。我们拭目以待。

CNN fake news and the camera just went off, the camera. The camera just went off. Turn it back on. Hey, by the way, hold it. Look at this, and honestly, all events are like this. It's about us. We added another 225,000 jobs last month alone. And that makes seven million jobs since our election, seven million. The unemployment rate in the great state of South Carolina. content.zh: 我的一位手下走过来对我说：“总统先生，他们想在俄罗斯、俄罗斯、俄罗斯的问题上打败你。” 但结果不太好。他们没能成功。他们尝试了弹劾骗局。那是在一次完美的对话中。他们什么都试过了。他们一遍又一遍地尝试。自从你上任以来，他们就一直在这么做。一切都在发生变化。他们输了。一切都在发生变化。想想看。想想看。这就是他们的新骗局。但我们做了一件非常了不起的事情。在这个幅员辽阔的国家，我们只有15个人，因为我们行动早。我们行动早，我们本来可以拥有更多人。我们做得很好。我们的国家做得很好。我们如此团结。我们如此团结。共和党从未像现在这样团结。我们国家历史上从未有过像现在这样的运动。从来没有过。所以我们想谈的一个统计数据，请说。说美国。没关系。美国。一个我最近才听说、却没人知道的数字，让我震惊。平均每年有3.5万人死于流感。有人知道吗？3.5万人，可不是个小数目。也可能达到10万人，也可能达到2.7万人。他们说通常每年至少有2.7万人死亡，最多达到10万人。到目前为止，美国还没有人死于冠状病毒。没有人。这并不意味着我们不会，我们已经做好了充分的准备。这并不意味着我们不会，但想想看。你听说有3.5万到4万人死亡，我们还没有人死亡，你就会想媒体是不是歇斯底里了。CNN播假新闻，摄像机就关了，摄像机。摄像机就关了。把它重新打开。嘿，顺便说一句，等等。看看这个，说实话，所有事件都是这样的。这与我们有关。一切都关乎我们。我希望他们能拿起摄像机，把竞技场展示出来。他们从来不这么做。他们从来不这么做。他们从来不展示竞技场。你能听到，因为当你听到的时候，那不是200人。那不是100人。那是成千上万的人，包括场外的人。你能听到。他们总是展示我的脸。看到那张脸了吗？他们展示我的脸。我希望他们展示竞技场，而不是我的脸，对吧？[...] 当极左派用这些卑鄙的骗局浪费美国时间时，我们一直在杀死恐怖分子，创造就业机会，提高工资，制定公平贸易协议，保卫我们的边境，并提升每个种族、宗教、肤色和信仰的公民。仅上个月我们就增加了22.5万个工作岗位。这意味着自我们当选以来，我们已经增加了700万个工作岗位，700万个。伟大的南卡罗来纳州的失业率。你听说过那个地方吗？

content.en: The delays the WHO experienced in declaring a public health emergency cost valuable time tremendous amounts of time; more time was lost in the delay it took to get a team of international experts and to examine the outbreak which we wanted to do which they should have done. The inability of the WHO to obtain virus samples to this date has deprived the scientific community of essential data. New data that emerges across the world on a daily basis points to the unreliability of the initial reports and the world received all sorts of false information about transmission and mortality. The silence of the WHO on the disappearance of scientific researchers and doctors and new restrictions on the sharing of research into the origins of COVID-19 in the country of origin is deeply concerning especially when we put up by far the largest amount of money, not even close. Had the WHO done its job to get medical experts into China to objectively assess the situation on the ground and to call out China's lack of transparency, the outbreak could have been contained as a source with very little death, very little death, and certainly very little death by comparison. This would have saved thousands of lives and avoided worldwide economic damage. Instead the WHO willingly took China's assurances to face value, and they took it just at face value and defended the actions of the Chinese government, even praising China for its so-called transparency. I don't think so. The WHO pushed China's misinformation about the virus, saying it was not communicable, and there was no need for travel bans. They told us when we put on our travel ban a very strong travel ban, there was no need to do it. Don't do it; they actually fought us. The WHO's reliance on China's disclosures likely caused a 20-fold increase in cases worldwide, and it may be much more than that.
content.zh: 世卫组织在宣布公共卫生紧急事件方面遭遇的延误，浪费了大量宝贵时间；更糟的是，我们耽搁了组建国际专家团队并调查疫情的时间，而这正是我们想要的，他们本应这样做。世卫组织至今仍未能获得病毒样本，这使得科学界无法获得关键数据。世界各地每天都会出现新的数据，表明最初报告的不可靠性，世界收到了各种关于传播和死亡率的虚假信息。世卫组织对科研人员和医生失踪事件保持沉默，并对在原产国分享新冠病毒起源研究成果施加新的限制，这令人深感担忧，尤其是在我们投入的资金是迄今为止最多的，甚至远远超过我们的情况下。如果世卫组织履行职责，派遣医疗专家前往中国，客观评估当地情况，并指出中国缺乏透明度，那么疫情本可以得到控制，死亡人数将非常少，相比之下，死亡人数肯定非常少。这将挽救成千上万的生命，并避免全球经济损失。相反，世卫组织却轻信了中国的保证，他们信以为真，为中国政府的行动辩护，甚至称赞中国所谓的透明度。我不这么认为。世卫组织散布了中国关于病毒的错误信息，称病毒不具有传染性，无需旅行禁令。当我们实施旅行禁令时，他们却告诉我们，没有必要这么做。千万别这么做；他们实际上是在与我们作对。世卫组织对中国信息披露的依赖可能导致全球病例增加了20倍，而且可能远不止于此。

content.en: You know in Germany, if you have a bad heart and you’re ready to die, or if you have cancer and you’re going to be dying soon and you catch Covid, that happens: we mark it down to Covid. You know, our doctors get more money if somebody dies from Covid. You know that, right? I mean our doctors are very smart people. So what they do is, they say, "I’m sorry, but you know everybody dies of Covid." But in Germany and other places, if you have a heart attack, or if you have cancer, you’re terminally ill, you catch Covid, they say you died of cancer, you died of a heart attack. With us? When in doubt, choose Covid. Now, it’s true. Now, they’ll say ‘oh, it’s terrible what he said’, but that’s true. It’s like $2,000 more.
content.zh: 你知道在德国，如果你心脏病发作，濒临死亡，或者你得了癌症，生命垂危，却又感染了新冠病毒，这种情况会发生：我们会把这笔钱算作新冠病毒。 你知道，如果有人死于新冠病毒，我们的医生就能拿到更多钱。你知道的，对吧？ 我的意思是，我们的医生非常聪明。所以他们会说：“对不起，但你知道每个人都死于新冠病毒。” 但在德国和其他地方，如果你心脏病发作，或者你得了癌症，身患绝症，感染了新冠病毒，他们会说你死于癌症，死于心脏病。 和我们一样吗？如果你有疑问，就选择新冠病毒。 这确实是真的。他们会说：“哦，他说的太可怕了”，但这是真的。这差不多要多花2000美元。

content.en: I would like to begin by addressing the heinous attack on the United States Capitol. Like all Americans, I am outraged by the violence, lawlessness, and mayhem. I immediately deployed the National Guard and Federal law enforcement to secure the building and expel the intruders. America is and must always be a nation of law and order. The demonstrators who infiltrated the Capitol have defiled the seat of American democracy. To those who engage in the acts of violence and destruction, you do not represent our country. And to those who broke the law, you will pay. We have just been through an intense election, and emotions are high. But now tempers must be cooled and calm restored. We must get on with the business of America. My campaign vigorously pursued every legal avenue to contest the election results. My only goal was to ensure the integrity of the vote. In so doing, I was fighting to defend American democracy. I continue to strongly believe that we must reform our election laws to verify the identity and eligibility of all voters and to ensure faith and confidence in all future elections.
content.zh: 首先，我想谈谈对美国国会大厦的令人发指的袭击。和所有美国人一样，我对暴力、无法无天和混乱感到义愤填膺。我立即部署了国民警卫队和联邦执法人员，以确保国会大厦的安全，并驱逐入侵者。美国现在是、也必须永远是一个法治的国家。闯入国会大厦的示威者玷污了美国民主的宝座。对于那些参与暴力和破坏行为的人，你们不代表我们的国家。对于那些违法的人，你们将付出代价。 我们刚刚经历了一场激烈的选举，情绪激动。但现在必须冷静下来，恢复平静。我们必须继续处理美国的事务。我的竞选团队积极寻求一切合法途径来对抗选举结果。我唯一的目标就是确保投票的公正性。我这样做，就是在为捍卫美国民主而战。我始终坚信，我们必须改革选举法，以核实所有选民的身份和资格，并确保人们对未来所有选举的信心。

content.en: The Republican Party can never again be respected or strong with political “leaders” like Sen. Mitch McConnell at its helm. McConnell’s dedication to business as usual, status quo policies, together with his lack of political insight, wisdom, skill, and personality, has rapidly driven him from Majority Leader to Minority Leader, and it will only get worse. The Democrats and Chuck Schumer play McConnell like a fiddle—they’ve never had it so good—and they want to keep it that way! We know our America First agenda is a winner, not McConnell’s Beltway First agenda or Biden’s America Last. It was a complete election disaster in Georgia, and certain other swing states. McConnell did nothing, and will never do what needs to be done in order to secure a fair and just electoral system into the future. He doesn’t have what it takes, never did, and never will. content.en: For decades, our country has been looted, pillaged, raped and plundered by nations near and far, both friend and foe alike. Taxpayers have been ripped off for more than 50 years, but it is not going to happen anymore. This is one of the most important days, in my opinion, in American history. It’s our declaration of economic independence. …now it’s our turn to prosper and in so doing use trillions and trillions of dollars to reduce our taxes and pay down our national debt and it will all happen very quickly. With today’s action we are finally going to be able to make America great again, greater than ever before. Jobs and factories will come roaring back into our country, and you see it happening already. We will supercharge our domestic industrial base. We will pry open foreign markets and break down foreign trade barriers. And ultimately, more production at home will mean stronger competition and lower prices for consumers. This will be indeed the golden age of America. It’s coming back and we’re going to come back very strongly. They tried to bring back tariffs to save our country, but it was gone. It was gone. It was too late. Nothing could have been done. It took years and years to get out of that depression, far longer than even FDR had that office right over there for a long period of time. We will charge them approximately half of what they are and have been charging us because we are being very kind. This is not full reciprocal. This is kind reciprocal. These tariffs are going to give us growth like you haven’t seen before. And it’ll be something very special to watch. My fellow Americans, this is Liberation Day… April 2nd, 2025, will forever be remembered as the day American industry was reborn, the day America's destiny was reclaimed and the day that we began to make America wealthy again. From 1789 to 1913, we were a tariff-backed nation and the United States was proportionately the wealthiest it has ever been. So wealthy, in fact, that in the 1880s, they established a commission to decide what they were going to do with the vast sums of money they were collecting…. Then in 1913, for reasons unknown to mankind, they established the income tax so that citizens rather than foreign countries would start paying the money necessary to run our government. Then in 1929, it all came to a very abrupt end with the Great Depression, and it would have never happened if they had stayed with the tariff policy. It would have been a much different story. In short, chronic trade deficits are no longer merely an economic problem. They're a national emergency that threatens our security and our very way of life. It's a very great threat to our country.
content.zh: 几十年来，我们的国家饱受掠夺、抢劫、蹂躏和劫掠，其祸患不胜枚举，不一而足，无论是敌是友。 纳税人被敲诈了五十多年，但这种情况不会再发生了。 在我看来，这是美国历史上最重要的日子之一。这是我们经济独立的宣言……现在轮到我们走向繁荣，为此，我们将投入数万亿美元来减税、偿还国债，这一切都将迅速实现。凭借今天的行动，我们终于能够让美国再次伟大，比以往任何时候都更加强大。 就业和工厂将强势回归我们的国家，你们已经看到这一切正在发生。我们将增强国内工业基础。我们将开拓海外市场，打破对外贸易壁垒。最终，国内生产规模的扩大将意味着更激烈的竞争和更低的消费价格。这必将是美国的黄金时代。黄金时代正在回归，而且我们将强势回归。他们试图恢复关税来拯救我们的国家，但关税已经失效。失效了。为时已晚，什么也做不了了。我们花了好多年才走出那场大萧条，甚至比罗斯福在那边设立办公室的时间还要长得多。 我们将向他们收取大约一半的费用，因为我们非常友善。这不是完全对等的，而是善意的对等。 这些关税将给我们带来前所未有的增长。这将是非常值得关注的。 我的美国同胞们，今天是解放日……2025年4月2日，将永远被铭记为美国工业重生的日子，美国命运被重新掌控的日子，以及我们开始让美国再次富裕起来的日子。 从1789年到1913年，我们是一个依靠关税支撑的国家，而美国当时的富裕程度达到了历史最高水平。事实上，他们如此富有，以至于在19世纪80年代，他们成立了一个委员会来决定如何处理他们所收集到的巨额资金…… 然后在1913年，出于人类未知的原因，他们设立了所得税，以便公民而不是外国开始支付我们政府运作所需的资金。然后在1929年，这一切随着大萧条而突然结束，如果他们坚持关税政策，这一切都不会发生。情况将会大不相同。 简而言之，长期贸易逆差不再仅仅是一个经济问题。它是一种威胁我们安全和生活方式的国家紧急状态。这对我们国家构成了巨大的威胁。

content.en: "If you're here today and think that you're too young to do something great, let me tell you that you are wrong. You're not too young. You can have great success at a very young age ... In America, with drive and ambition, young people can do anything." "You have to love what you do. You have to. I rarely see somebody that's successful that doesn't love what he or she does ... If I didn't find it fun, I wouldn't be successful." "The third thing is to think big. If you're going to do something, you might as well think big. I know a lot of people, they've thought small, they were very smart. I know others that weren't nearly as smart, but they had a better picture of the big picture, because it's just as hard to solve a small problem as a big problem and it's just as much energy and everything else, except the result is going to be a smaller one. So love what you do and think big if it's possible." "Work hard. Never, ever stop," Trump said, before mentioning pro golf legend Gary Player. The president said Player "wasn't as big as other men, he was on the small side ... but he worked very, very hard. He made up for it. He never stopped." "Don't lose your momentum. You just want to keep it going. And you have to know, if you are losing it, you have to know when you are losing it, so maybe you stop and maybe it's time to stop. Listen to the feedback, think through your plan very carefully and keep moving fast." "If you want to change the world, you have to have the courage to be an outsider. In other words, you have to take certain risks and do things a little bit differently; otherwise, if that were the case, everybody would be successful. Doesn't work that way. Progress never comes from those satisfied with the failures of a broken system; it comes from those who want to fix the broken system. If you want to go to the top, you're just never going to do it unless you break the system ... You really do, you have to break the system a little bit and follow your own instincts. But if your vision is right, nothing will hold you down. Nothing. You have to have the right vision." "Trust your instincts. Common sense. You can go very far in life with common sense and I applied that to politics because some of these things, like, they had open borders. Let everybody in the whole world flow into our country. That's not common sense." "Everybody should believe in the American dream. It's real, it's there and it's right before you." "Think of yourself as a winner. The power of positive thinking. Don't consider yourself a victim. Consider yourself a winner. In recent years, too many of our young people have really been taught to think of themselves as victims and blame people and be angry. Don't be angry. In America, we reject that idea that anyone is born a victim. Our heroes are the ones who take charge of their own destiny, make their own luck and determine their own fate, despite the odds." "Be an original," Trump said as his penultimate piece of advice for the graduating class. "The all-time greats were people who had the confidence to be a little different ... God only created one of you. Remember that. You're all different, some are close, but nobody is the same. You're one of a kind so don't try to be someone else. Just be yourself." "Never, ever give up. Never give up. Don't stop. Never, ever give up. Victory is right around the corner."
content.zh: “如果你今天在这里，还觉得自己太年轻，无法成就一番伟业，那么让我告诉你，你错了。你并不年轻。你可以在很小的时候就取得巨大的成功……在美国，只要有动力和雄心，年轻人什么都能做。” “你必须热爱你所做的事情。你必须热爱。我很少看到成功的人不热爱自己的工作……如果我觉得它没有乐趣，我就不会成功。” “第三件事是胸怀大志。如果你要做某件事，你最好胸怀大志。我认识很多人，他们从小处着眼，他们非常聪明。我也认识一些人，他们远不如我聪明，但他们对大局有更好的理解，因为解决一个小问题和解决一个大问题一样困难，需要投入的精力和其他一切也一样多，只是结果会更小。所以，热爱你所做的事情，如果可能的话，胸怀大志。” “努力工作。永不停歇，”特朗普说道，然后提到了职业高尔夫传奇人物加里·普莱尔。总统说，普莱尔“不像其他人那么高大，他身材矮小……但他非常非常努力。他弥补了这一点。他从未停止。” “不要失去你的动力。你只想保持下去。你必须知道，如果你正在失去动力，你必须知道你什么时候失去它，所以也许你应该停下来，也许是时候停下来了。倾听反馈，仔细思考你的计划，并继续快速前进。” “如果你想改变世界，你必须有勇气成为一个局外人。换句话说，你必须承担一定的风险，做一些略有不同的事情；否则，如果真是这样，每个人都会成功。但事实并非如此。进步从来不会来自那些满足于一个支离破碎的体系失败的人；它来自那些想要修复这个支离破碎的体系的人。如果你想登上顶峰，除非你打破这个体系，否则你永远也做不到……你真的需要打破这个体系，你必须稍微打破一下，然后遵循自己的直觉。但如果你的愿景是正确的，没有什么能阻挡你。没有什么。你必须拥有正确的愿景。” “相信你的直觉。常识。常识可以让你在生活中走得很远，我把这一点运用到政治上，因为有些事情，比如，他们开放了边境。让全世界的每个人都涌入我们的国家。这不是常识。” “每个人都应该相信美国梦。它是真实的，它就在那里，就在你面前。” “把自己当成赢家。积极思考的力量在于此。不要把自己当成受害者。要把自己当成赢家。近年来，太多年轻人被灌输了把自己当成受害者、责怪他人、愤怒的观念。别生气。在美国，我们拒绝任何人天生就是受害者的观念。我们的英雄是那些掌控自己命运、创造自己运气、决定自己命运的人，无论逆境如何。” “做一个独具匠心的人，”特朗普在给毕业生的倒数第二条建议中说道。“历史上最伟大的人物，都是那些有信心与众不同的人……上帝只创造了你们一个人。记住这一点。你们每个人都不一样，有些人很接近，但没有人是完全一样的。你是独一无二的，所以不要试图成为别人。做你自己就好。” “永不放弃。永不放弃。不要停止。永不放弃。胜利就在眼前。”

content.en: David Brody: Radical Islam: to Evangelicals, this is a bread and butter issue. You said there's a Muslim problem in this country. What do you mean by that exactly? Donald Trump: Bill O'Reilly asked me is there a Muslim problem? And I said absolutely, yes. In fact I went a step further. I said I didn't see Swedish people knocking down the World Trade Center. It was very interesting. I thought that was going to be a controversial statement and somebody, I think it was Dennis Miller introduced me, he was doing like an analysis of me, he said, I love it. The guy said what the truth is. He didn't mince his words. He didn't say, 'Oh, gee, no there's not a Muslim problem, everybody's wonderful.' And by the way, many, many, most Muslims are wonderful people, but is there a Muslim problem? Look what's happening. Look what happened right here in my city with the World Trade Center and lots of other places. So I said it and I thought it was going to be very controversial but actually it was very well received. I think people want the truth. I think they're tired of politicians. They're tired of politically correct stuff. I mean I could have said, 'Oh absolutely not Bill, there's no Muslim problem, everything is wonderful, just forget about the World Trade Center.' But you have to speak the truth. We're so politically correct that this country is falling apart. Brody: With some evangelicals there are some problems with the teachings of the Koran. Do you have concerns about the Koran? Trump: Well, I'll tell you what. The Koran is very interesting. A lot of people say it teaches love and there is a very big group of people who really understand the Koran far better than I do. I'm certainly not an expert, to put it mildly. But there's something there that teaches some very negative vibe. I mean things are happening, when you look at people blowing up all over the streets that are in some of the countries over in the Middle East, just blowing up a super market with not even soldiers, just people, when 250 people die in a super market that are shopping, where people die in a store or in a street. There's a lot of hatred there that's some place. Now I don't know if that's from the Koran. I don't know if that's from some place else. But there's tremendous hatred out there that I've never seen anything like it. So, you have two views. You have the view that the Koran is all about love and then you have the view that the Koran is, that there's a lot of hate in the Koran.
content.zh: 大卫·布罗迪：激进伊斯兰：对福音派来说，这事关民生。你说这个国家存在穆斯林问题。你到底是什么意思？ 唐纳德·特朗普：比尔·奥莱利问我，穆斯林问题存在吗？我说绝对存在。事实上，我更进一步说，我没有看到瑞典人推倒世贸中心。这很有意思。我以为这会是一个有争议的言论，后来有人，我记得是丹尼斯·米勒，介绍我来，他当时正在分析我，他说，我喜欢这句话。那家伙说出了实话。他直言不讳。他没有说，“哦，天哪，不，这不是穆斯林问题，每个人都很棒。” 顺便说一句，很多很多穆斯林都是很棒的人，但穆斯林问题存在吗？看看现在发生了什么。看看就在我所在的城市，世贸中心和许多其他地方发生了什么。所以我说了，我以为会引起很大争议，但实际上反响很好。我觉得人们想要真相。我觉得他们厌倦了政客，厌倦了政治正确的玩意儿。我的意思是，我本来可以说：“哦，比尔，绝对不是，穆斯林问题不存在，一切都很好，别提世贸中心了。” 但你必须说实话。我们太政治正确了，以至于这个国家正在分崩离析。 布罗迪：一些福音派人士对《古兰经》的教义有一些疑问。你对《古兰经》有什么顾虑吗？ 特朗普：嗯，我告诉你。《古兰经》很有意思。很多人说它教导爱，而且有很多人比我更了解《古兰经》。委婉地说，我当然不是专家。但《古兰经》里确实有一些东西会给人带来非常负面的感受。我的意思是，事情正在发生，你看到中东一些国家街头到处都是炸药，甚至连超市都没炸，只有人，250人在超市购物时丧生，商店里或街道上也有人丧生。那里充满了仇恨。我不知道这是否源于《古兰经》，也不知道这是否源于其他地方。但那里的仇恨之深，是我从未见过的。所以，你有两种观点。一种观点认为《古兰经》全是关于爱的，另一种观点认为《古兰经》充满了仇恨。

content.en: I watched when the World Trade Center came tumbling down. And I watched in Jersey City, N.J., where thousands and thousands of people were cheering as that building was coming down. Thousands of people were cheering. It was on television. I saw it. It was well covered at the time, George. Now, I know they don't like to talk about it, but it was well covered at the time. There were people over in New Jersey that were watching it, a heavy Arab population, that were cheering as the buildings came down. Not good.
content.zh: 我亲眼目睹了世贸中心倒塌的场景。在新泽西州泽西市，我看到成千上万的人在大楼倒塌时欢呼雀跃。成千上万的人欢呼雀跃。 电视上也播出了。我亲眼看到了。乔治，当时报道得非常详细。我知道他们不喜欢谈论这件事，但当时确实报道得非常详细。新泽西州也有人目睹了这一切，那里有很多阿拉伯人，他们在大楼倒塌时欢呼雀跃。这可不是什么好事。

content.en: For many decades, we've enriched foreign industry at the expense of American industry, subsidized the armies of other countries while allowing for the very sad depletion of our military. We've defended other nations' borders while refusing to defend our own and spent trillions and trillions of dollars overseas while America's infrastructure has fallen into disrepair and decay. We've made other countries rich while the wealth, strength, and confidence of our country has dissipated over the horizon. One by one, the factories shuttered and left our shores, with not even a thought about the millions and millions of American workers that were left behind. The wealth of our middle class has been ripped from their homes and then redistributed all across the world. But that is the past. And now we are looking only to the future. We, assembled here today, are issuing a new decree to be heard in every city, in every foreign capital, and in every hall of power. From this day forward, a new vision will govern our land. From this this day forward, it's going to be only America first. America first. Every decision on trade, on taxes, on immigration, on foreign affairs, will be made to benefit American workers and American families.
content.zh: 几十年来，我们以牺牲美国工业为代价，扶持外国工业，补贴其他国家的军队，却任由我国军队惨遭损耗。我们保卫其他国家的边界​​，却拒绝保卫自己的边界；我们向海外投入了数万亿美元，而美国的基础设施却年久失修、腐朽不堪。我们让其他国家富裕起来，而我国的财富、实力和自信却在地平线上消散殆尽。工厂一家接一家地关闭，迁离美国本土，丝毫没有考虑过留下的数百万美国工人。我们中产阶级的财富被掠夺一空，然后被重新分配到世界各地。但那是过去。现在，我们只着眼于未来。今天，我们聚集在这里，颁布一项新的法令，让每座城市、每一座外国首都、每一座权力殿堂都能听到。从今天起，一个新的愿景将统治我们的国家。从今天起，美国优先。美国优先。所有关于贸易、税收、移民和外交事务的决定，都将以美国工人和美国家庭的利益为出发点。

from.en: Inaugural address, (January 20, 2017)
from.zh: 就职演说（2017年1月20日）

content.en: We must protect our borders from the ravages of other countries making our products, stealing our companies, and destroying our jobs. Protection will lead to great prosperity and strength. I will fight for you with every breath in my body, and I will never, ever let you down. America will start winning again, winning like never before. We will bring back our jobs. We will bring back our borders. We will bring back our wealth. And we will bring back our dreams. We will build new roads and highways and bridges and airports and tunnels and railways all across our wonderful Nation. We will get our people off of welfare and back to work, rebuilding our country with American hands and American labor. We will follow two simple rules: Buy American and hire American. We will seek friendship and good will with the nations of the world, but we do so with the understanding that it is the right of all nations to put their own interests first. We do not seek to impose our way of life on anyone, but rather to let it shine as an example—we will shine—for everyone to follow. We will reinforce old alliances and form new ones and unite the civilized world against radical Islamic terrorism, which we will eradicate completely from the face of the Earth. At the bedrock of our politics will be a total allegiance to the United States of America, and through our loyalty to our country, we will rediscover our loyalty to each other. When you open your heart to patriotism, there is no room for prejudice. The Bible tells us, "How good and pleasant it is when God's people live together in unity." We must speak our minds openly, debate our disagreements honestly, but always pursue solidarity. When America is united, America is totally unstoppable. There should be no fear: We are protected, and we will always be protected. We will be protected by the great men and women of our military and law enforcement, and most importantly, we will be protected by God.
content.zh: 我们必须保护我们的边境，免受其他国家制造我们的产品、窃取我们的公司、摧毁我们就业机会的蹂躏。保护将带来巨大的繁荣和强大。我将竭尽全力为你们而战，我永远不会让你们失望。美国将再次赢得胜利，而且是前所未有的胜利。我们将夺回我们的工作岗位。我们将夺回我们的边境。我们将夺回我们的财富。我们将夺回我们的梦想。我们将在我们伟大的国家各地修建新的公路、高速公路、桥梁、机场、隧道和铁路。我们将让我们的人民摆脱社会福利，重返工作岗位，用美国人的双手和劳动力重建我们的国家。我们将遵循两条简单的规则：购买美国产品，雇用美国人。我们将寻求与世界各国的友谊和善意，但我们这样做是基于这样的理解：所有国家都有权将自身利益放在首位。我们不寻求将我们的生活方式强加于人，而是要让它成为榜样——我们将闪耀光芒——让每个人都能效仿。我们将巩固旧有联盟，建立新联盟，团结文明世界共同对抗激进伊斯兰恐怖主义，并将其从地球上彻底铲除。我们政治的基石是对美利坚合众国的绝对忠诚，通过对国家的忠诚，我们将重新发现彼此的忠诚。当你敞开心扉拥抱爱国主义时，偏见便无处容身。圣经告诉我们：“看哪，圣徒和睦同居是何等地善，何等地美。” 我们必须公开表达自己的想法，坦诚地辩论彼此的分歧，但始终追求团结一致。当美国团结一致时，美国将势不可挡。我们不应感到恐惧：我们受到保护，而且将永远受到保护。我们将受到我们伟大的军人和执法人员的保护，最重要的是，我们将受到上帝的保护。

content.en: Think of this. We give them everything, including military protection and trade, and now we have to pay them to go there. As President I will not allow this, will end very quickly.
content.zh: 想想看。我们给了他们一切，包括军事保护和贸易，现在却要付钱让他们去那里。作为总统，我不会允许这种情况发生，这种情况很快就会结束。

from.zh: “从2024年开始，美国公民前往欧洲旅行必须自费办理签证。”

content.en: You know, somebody said, ‘Oh, the shelves are going to be open.’ Well, maybe the children will have two dolls instead of 30 dolls. So maybe the two dolls will cost a couple bucks more than they would normally.
content.zh: 你知道，有人说：“哦，货架要空了。” 好吧，也许孩子们会有两个娃娃，而不是30个。所以这两个娃娃的价格可能会比平时贵几块钱。

content.en: India has a true friend in the White House.
content.zh: 印度在白宫有一位真正的朋友。

content.en: I love Iowa, and I'm going there right after this, going up to New Hampshire, I'm going to Iowa because I want to win Iowa. Everyone says don't say that. Just say you're going to do well. That's the closest, but I can't do that. The safe way is, I think I'll do well. I want to win Iowa.
content.zh: 我爱爱荷华州，这之后我马上就去那里，然后去新罕布什尔州。我要去爱荷华州，因为我想赢得爱荷华州。大家都说别这么说。就说你会做得很好。这已经是最接近的了，但我做不到。稳妥的说法是，我觉得我会做得很好。我想赢得爱荷华州。

from.en: Presidential Candidate Donald Trump at Liberty University, C-SPAN (18 January 2016)
from.zh: 总统候选人唐纳德·特朗普在自由大学，C-SPAN（2016年1月18日）

content.en: “We’re going to place strong protections to stop banks and regulators from trying to debank you from your—our political beliefs what they do. They want to debank you. We’re going to debank—think of this. They want to take away your country. Electric cars... They wanna take away your rights. They wanna take away your country. The things they’re doing. All electric cars. Give me a break. If you want an electric car, great. But they don’t go far. They’re very expensive. They gotta be made in China. That’s why I think I’m gonna get the autoworkers to vote for Trump. You know, we’re having great, great talks. But think of what they wanna do. They wanna take away your rights.”
content.zh: 我们将采取强有力的保护措施，阻止银行和监管机构试图剥夺你的政治信仰。他们想剥夺你的银行账户。我们要剥夺你的银行账户——想想看。他们想夺走你的国家。电动汽车……他们想剥夺你的权利。他们想夺走你的国家。他们正在做的事情。全是电动汽车。饶了我吧。如果你想要一辆电动汽车，那很好。但它们跑不了多远。它们非常昂贵。它们必须在中国制造。这就是为什么我认为我会让汽车工人投票给特朗普。你知道，我们正在进行非常棒的谈判。但想想他们想做什么。他们想剥夺你的权利。”

from.en: 17 January 2024 at a campaign rally in New Hampshire, reported by several sources.
from.zh: 据多位消息人士报道，2024年1月17日，在新罕布什尔州的一场竞选集会上。

content.en: Christie, he’s eating right now. He can’t be bothered. Sir, please do not call him a fat pig, that’s very disrespect. See, I’m trying to be nice. Don’t call him a fat pig. You can’t do that. I was extremely respectful of Sloppy Chris Christie today in New Hampshire. During a speech in front of a large crowd of Patriots, somebody shouted out that "Chris Christie is a fat pig." Rather than acknowleding that, which many speakers would have done, I said "No, No, he is not a fat pig." I'm sure Chris would have been very happy with my defense of him!
content.zh: 克里斯蒂，他现在正在吃饭呢。他懒得理他。 先生，请不要叫他肥猪，这太不尊重人了。 瞧，我只是想表现得友好些。别叫他肥猪。你不能那样做。 今天在新罕布什尔州，我对邋遢的克里斯·克里斯蒂非常尊重。在面对一大群爱国者球迷发表演讲时，有人喊道：“克里斯·克里斯蒂是头肥猪。”我没有像很多演讲者那样承认，而是说：“不，不，他不是头肥猪。”我相信克里斯会很高兴我为他辩护！

from.en: 10 August 2024 Chris Christie, cited in "Trump Is Pretending He Didn’t Call Christie a ‘Fat Pig’", Intelligencer (August 10, 2024)
from.zh: 2024年8月10日，克里斯·克里斯蒂，引自《情报员》（2024年8月10日）“特朗普假装没叫克里斯蒂‘肥猪’”

content.en: There is a great man, a great leader in Europe — Viktor Orban [...] He is the Prime Minister of Hungary. He is a very great leader, a very strong man. Some people don't like him because he's too strong.
content.zh: 欧洲有一位伟人，一位伟大的领袖——维克托·奥尔班[...]他是匈牙利总理。他是一位非常伟大的领袖，一位非常强势的人物。有些人不喜欢他，因为他太强势了。

content.en: I don’t need publicity. I get a lot of publicity. I would like to get a lot less publicity. I would hire a public relations agent to get less publicity.
content.zh: 我不需要宣传。我有很多宣传。我希望少一点宣传。 我会聘请一位公关代理人来减少宣传。

content.en: The people, my people, are so smart, and you know what they say about my people? The polls. They say I have the most loyal people — did you ever see that? Where I could stand in the middle of 5th Avenue and shoot somebody, and I wouldn't lose any voters. It's like incredible. No, they say, "Trump we love you too." Trump's voters are by far, ya know, I'm at sixty-eight and sixty-nine percent, I'm at ninety percent, total, like, "Will you say absolutely?" I think it's sixty-eight and sixty-nine percent. "Will you most likely stay?" That gets into the nineties. Other guys like a ten. A guy like Jeb Bush, he has a nobody, but he's like, they don't have people. They have nothing. Rubio, soft. They're all soft. My people stay, by the way, Cruz, soft. When they heard about this thing with that he was bordering Canada, nobody knew them? He lost a lot of people! He's gone down big in the polls. Ted Cruz has gone down big in the polls. That doesn't mean he's giving us a fight in Iowa, that doesn't mean you can stay home, okay, see, you with the smile? It doesn't mean that. You gotta go out cause we can't take any chances.
content.zh: 我的选民们非常聪明，你知道他们怎么评价我的选民吗？民调。他们说我拥有最忠诚的选民——你见过吗？我站在第五大道中间开枪打人，也不会失去任何选民。真是不可思议。不，他们说，“特朗普，我们也爱你。”特朗普的选民数量遥遥领先，你知道吗，我的支持率是68%到69%，我的支持率是90%，他们问：“你绝对支持吗？”我想是68%到69%。“你最有可能留下来吗？”这个数字接近90%。其他人大概只有10%。像杰布·布什这样的人，他没什么人脉，但他就像是，他们没有人脉。他们什么都没有。卢比奥，软弱的。他们都是软弱的。顺便说一句，我的选民，克鲁兹，也是软弱的。当他们听说他与加拿大接壤时，竟然没人认识他们？他失去了很多人！他的民调支持率大幅下滑。泰德·克鲁兹的民调支持率也大幅下滑。但这并不意味着他会在爱荷华州给我们带来竞争，也不意味着你们可以待在家里，好吗，看到了吗，你还笑着？这并不意味着什么。你们必须出门，因为我们不能冒险。

from.en: Speech at campaign rally (23 January 2016), Sioux Center, Iowa.
from.zh: 2016年1月23日，爱荷华州苏城，竞选集会演讲。

content.en: The immigration laws of the United States give the president powers to suspend entry into the country of any class of persons. Now, any class — it really is determined and to be determined by the president for the interests of the United States. And it's as he or she deems appropriate. Hopefully it's he in this case.
content.zh: 美国移民法赋予总统权力，可以暂停任何类别人员入境。至于任何类别——这实际上由总统为了美国利益而决定，并且由总统自行决定。这取决于他或她认为合适的程度。希望在本案中，他就是那个人。

from.en: Speech after the 2016 Orlando nightclub shooting (transcript)
from.zh: 2016年奥兰多夜总会枪击案后讲话（文字记录）

content.en: She says the solution is to ban guns. They tried that in France which has among the toughest gun laws anywhere in the world, and 130 people were brutally murdered by Islamic terrorists in cold blood. Her plan is to disarm law abiding Americans, abolishing the Second Amendment, and leaving only the bad guys and terrorists with guns. No good. Not going to happen, folks. ... She wants to take away American's guns and then admit the very people who want to slaughter us. Let them come into the country, we don't have guns. Let them come in, let them have all the fun they want.
content.zh: 她说解决办法是禁枪。法国的枪支法堪称世界最严，他们就曾尝试禁枪，结果130人惨遭伊斯兰恐怖分子冷血杀害。她的计划是解除守法美国人的武装，废除第二修正案，只留下坏人和恐怖分子持有枪支。这可不行。朋友们，这绝对不会发生。……她想夺走美国人的枪支，然后让那些想要屠杀我们的人进入美国。让他们进来吧，我们没有枪。让他们进来吧，让他们尽情享乐吧。

from.en: Speech after the 2016 Orlando nightclub shooting (transcript)
from.zh: 2016年奥兰多夜总会枪击案后讲话（文字记录）

content.en: When politicians talk about immigration reform, they usually mean the following: amnesty, open borders, and lower wages. Immigration reform should mean something else entirely: it should mean improvements to our laws and policies to make life better for American citizens. But if we are going to make our immigration system work, then we have to be prepared to talk honestly and without fear about these important and sensitive issues.
content.zh: 当政客们谈论移民改革时，他们通常指的是：大赦、开放边境和降低工资。移民改革应该意味着完全不同的东西：它应该意味着改进我们的法律和政策，以改善美国公民的生活。但如果我们要使我们的移民制度有效运作，那么我们必须准备好坦诚地、毫无畏惧地谈论这些重要而敏感的问题。

from.en: Immigration speech, Arizona (31 August 2016)
from.zh: 亚利桑那州移民演讲（2016年8月31日）

content.en: Maybe he didn't do a good job and I was unsatisfied with his work ... On occasion, four times, we used certain laws that are there. And when Secretary Clinton talks about people that didn't get paid, first of all, they did get paid a lot, but taken advantage of the laws of the nation. Now, if you want to change the laws, you've been there a long time, change the laws. But I take advantage of the laws of the nation because I'm running a company. My obligation right now is to do well for myself, my family, my employees, for my companies. And that's what I do. ... She [Hillary Clinton] doesn't say is that tens of thousands of people that are unbelievably happy and that love me.
content.zh: 也许他做得不好，我对他的工作不满意……有四次，我们援引了某些现行法律。克林顿国务卿谈到那些没有拿到工资的人时，首先，他们确实拿到了很多钱，但却利用了国家的法律。如果你想修改法律，你早就在那儿了，去修改法律吧。但我利用国家的法律，因为我在经营一家公司。我现在的义务是让自己、我的家人、我的员工、我的公司过得好。这就是我所做的……她（希拉里·克林顿）没说的是，成千上万的人无比幸福，爱我。

from.en: About not having paid to some of his employees.
from.zh: 关于他没有支付部分员工的工资。

content.en: I listened to a panel of judges and I'll comment on that — I will not comment on the statements made by, um, certainly one judge — but I have to be honest that if these judges wanted to, in my opinion, help the court, in terms of respect for the court, they'd do what they should be doing. I mean it's so sad, they should be, you know, when you read something so simple, and so beautifully written, and so perfectly written — other than the one statement, of course, having to do with "he" or "she" — but when you read something so perfectly written, and so clear to anybody, and then you have lawyers and you watched, I watched last night in amazement, and I heard things that I couldn't believe, things that really had nothing to do with what I just read, and I don't ever want to call a court biased, so I won't call it biased, and we haven't had a decision yet, but courts seem to be so political, and it would be so great for our justice system if they would be able to read a statement and do what's right. Every child in America should be able to play outside without fear, walk home without danger, and attend a school without being worried about drugs or gangs or violence.
content.zh: 我听取了一组法官的发言，并对此发表评论——我不会对其中一位法官的言论发表评论——但我必须诚实地说，如果这些法官愿意，在我看来，在尊重法庭方面帮助法庭，他们就会做他们应该做的事情。我的意思是，这太令人难过了，你知道，当你读到如此简单、如此优美、如此完美的陈述时——当然，除了那句与“他”或“她”有关的陈述——他们本应感到难过。但当你读到如此完美、对任何人来说都如此清晰的陈述时，然后你又有律师在场，你看着它，我昨晚惊呆了，听到了一些我简直不敢相信的事情，一些与我刚刚读到的内容完全无关的事情。我从来都不想说法庭有偏见，所以我不会说它有偏见，我们还没有做出判决，但法庭似乎太政治化了，如果他们能够宣读陈述并做出正确的判决，对我们的司法系统来说将是多么好啊。 每个美国孩子都应该能够无所畏惧地在户外玩耍，无所畏惧地步行回家，上学时不必担心毒品、帮派或暴力。

from.en: Remarks by President Trump at MCCA Winter Conference (8 February 2017)
from.zh: 特朗普总统在MCCA冬季会议上的讲话（2017年2月8日）

content.en: Well I just want to say that we are, you know, very honored by the victory that we had, 306 electoral college votes, we were not supposed to crack 220, you [turning to the Israeli PM] know that right? There was no way to 221, but then they said there's no way to 270 [Netanyahu tries to respond, but Trump continues, so then mouths "I thought he was talking to me"] and there's tremendous enthusiasm out there. I will say that, um, we are going to have peace, in this country, we are going to stop crime, in this country, we are going to do everything within our power to stop long-simmering racism, and every other thing that's going on, because a lot of bad things have been taking place over a long period of time. I think one of the reasons I won the election is we have a very, very divided nation, very divided, and hopefully I'll be able to do something about that, and I, you know, it's something that was very important to me. As far as people, Jewish people, so many friends, a daughter who happens to be here right now, a son-in-law, and three beautiful grandchildren, I think that you're going to see a lot different United States of America over the next three, four, or eight years, er, I think a lot of good things are happening, and you're going to see a lot of love, you're going to see a lot of love.
content.zh: 我只想说，我们非常荣幸能赢得306张选举人票，我们本来不应该突破220票，你（转向以色列总理）知道吗？本来不可能突破221票，但他们又说不可能突破270票（内塔尼亚胡试图回应，但特朗普继续说，然后装腔作势地说：“我以为他在跟我说话”）。大家的热情很高。我想说，嗯，我们将在这个国家拥有和平，我们将制止犯罪，我们将在这个国家竭尽所能，制止长期存在的种族主义，以及其他所有正在发生的事情，因为长期以来，很多不好的事情一直在发生。我认为我赢得大选的原因之一是我们国家非常非常分裂，非常分裂，我希望能够为此做点什么，你知道，这对我来说非常重要。至于人民，犹太人，这么多朋友，一个恰好现在就在这里的女儿，一个女婿，还有三个可爱的孙辈，我认为在未来三四年或八年里，你会看到一个截然不同的美国，呃，我认为很多美好的事情正在发生，你会看到很多爱，你会看到很多爱。

from.en: Trump responding to a reporter's question about rising anti-Semitic incidents and a perception of xenophobia in his administration, during a joint press conference with Benjamin Netanyahu, Prime Minister of Israel (15 February 2017)
from.zh: 特朗普在与以色列总理本雅明·内塔尼亚胡举行的联合新闻发布会上回答记者关于其政府中日益增多的反犹太事件和仇外情绪的问题（2017年2月15日）

content.en: Racism is evil -- and those who cause violence in its name are criminals and thugs, including KKK, neo-Nazis, white supremacists, and other hate groups are repugnant to everything we hold dear as Americans. Those who spread violence in the name of bigotry strike at the very core of America. As a candidate I promised to restore law and order to our country and our federal law enforcement agencies are following through on that pledge. We will spare no resource in fighting so that every American child can grow up free from violence and fear. We will defend and protect the sacred rights of all Americans and we will work together so that every citizen in this blessed land is free to follow their dreams, in their hearts, and to express the love and joy in our souls.
content.zh: 种族主义是邪恶的——那些以种族主义的名义制造暴力的人是罪犯和暴徒，包括三K党、新纳粹分子、白人至上主义者和其他仇恨团体，他们与我们美国人所珍视的一切格格不入。那些以偏见的名义传播暴力的人，正打击着美国的核心。作为候选人，我承诺要恢复我们国家的法律和秩序，我们的联邦执法机构正在履行这一承诺。我们将不遗余力地抗争，确保每一位美国儿童都能在远离暴力和恐惧的环境中成长。我们将捍卫和保护所有美国人的神圣权利，我们将共同努力，让这片神圣土地上的每一位公民都能自由地追寻心中的梦想，表达我们灵魂深处的爱与喜悦。

from.en: Subsequent statement regarding the violence at a far-right Charlottesville, VA rally held on August 11-12, 2017; Trump calls KKK, neo-Nazis, white supremacists 'repugnant' (14 August 2017)
from.zh: 关于2017年8月11日至12日弗吉尼亚州夏洛茨维尔极右翼集会暴力事件的后续声明；特朗普称三K党、新纳粹分子和白人至上主义者“令人厌恶”（2017年8月14日）

content.en: You guys know what this represents? Maybe it's the calm before the storm. [Reporter: What's the storm?] Could be the calm, the calm, before the storm. [Reporter: What storm Mr. President?] We have the world's great military people in this room, I'll tell you that, and we're going to have a great evening. [Reporter: What storm Mr. President?] You'll find out.
content.zh: 你们知道这代表什么吗？也许是暴风雨前的宁静。[记者：什么是暴风雨？] 可能是暴风雨前的宁静，真正的宁静。[记者：总统先生，什么暴风雨？] 我跟你们说，我们这间屋子里聚集着世界上最伟大的军人，我们将度过一个美好的夜晚。[记者：总统先生，什么暴风雨？] 你们会知道的。

from.en: Speaking during a photo op at the White House (6 October 2017)
from.zh: 在白宫拍照时发表讲话（2017年10月6日）

content.en: The libel laws are very weak in this country. If they were strong, it would be very helpful. You wouldn't have things like that happen where you can say whatever comes to your head.
content.zh: 这个国家的诽谤法非常薄弱。如果法律强硬一些，那就大有裨益了。你不会发生那种想说什么就说什么的事情。

from.en: Response to a question regarding Michael Wolff's Fire and Fury, Camp David speech (6 January 2018)
from.zh: 回应关于迈克尔·沃尔夫在戴维营发表《烈火与怒火》演讲的问题（2018年1月6日）

content.en: My administration has identified three major priorities for creating a safe, modern, and lawful immigration system: fully securing the border, ending chain migration, and canceling the visa lottery. Chain migration is a disaster, and very unfair to our country. The visa lottery is something that should have never been allowed in the first place. People enter a lottery to come into our country. What kind of a system is that? It is time for Congress to act and to protect Americans.

content.en: This evening we thank God for the brave sons of the United Kingdom and the United States who defeated the Nazis and the Nazi regime and liberated millions from tyranny. The bond between our nations was forever sealed in that "Great Crusade." As we honor our shared victory and heritage, we affirm the common values that will unite us long into the future: freedom, sovereignty, self-determination, the rule of law, and reverence for the rights given to us by Almighty God. From the Second World War to today, Her Majesty has stood as a constant symbol of these priceless traditions. She has embodied the spirit of dignity, duty, and patriotism that beats proudly in every British heart. On behalf of all Americans, I offer a toast to the eternal friendship of our people, the vitality of our nations, and to the long, cherished, and truly remarkable reign of Her Majesty the Queen. Thank you.

content.en: Captain Humayun Khan was a hero to our country and we should honor all who have made the ultimate sacrifice to keep our country safe. The real problem here are the radical Islamic terrorists who killed him, and the efforts of these radicals to enter our country to do us further harm. Given the state of the world today, we have to know everything about those looking to enter our country, and given the state of chaos in some of these countries, that is impossible. While I feel deeply for the loss of his son, Mr. Khan who has never met me, has no right to stand in front of millions of people and claim I have never read the Constitution, (which is false) and say many other inaccurate things. If I become President, I will make America safe again. Hillary Clinton should be held accountable for her central role in destabilizing the Middle East. She voted to send the United States to war against Iraq, helped lead the disastrous withdrawal of American troops years later that created the vacuum allowing the rise of ISIS, and has never met a regime change she didn't like (which have all been disasters) – not to mention her invasion of Libya and her abandonment of American personnel in Benghazi. The loss of these lives in Libya is directly traceable to Clinton, but their families' testimonials were rejected by the media. Clinton's actions have been reckless and have directly led to the loss of American lives. And her extreme immigration policies, as also laid out by American victims in Cleveland, will cause the preventable deaths of countless more -- while putting all residents, from all places, at greater risk of terrorism. As Bernie Sanders said on numerous occasions, Hillary Clinton suffers from "bad judgement." She is not qualified to serve as Commander in Chief.
content.zh: 胡马雍·汗上尉是我们国家的英雄，我们应该向所有为保卫国家安全而做出最终牺牲的人致敬。真正的问题是杀害他的极端伊斯兰恐怖分子，以及这些极端分子试图进入我国进一步危害我们。鉴于当今世界的局势，我们必须掌握所有试图进入我国的人的情况，而鉴于其中一些国家目前的混乱局面，这是不可能的。虽然我对他儿子的去世深感悲痛，但从未见过我的汗先生无权站在数百万人面前，声称我从未读过宪法（这是错误的），并发表许多其他不实言论。如果我当选总统，我将使美国再次安全。希拉里·克林顿应该为她在破坏中东稳定方面所扮演的核心角色承担责任。她投票支持美国对伊拉克开战，多年后协助领导了灾难性的美军撤军，这导致了ISIS崛起的权力真空。她从未遇到过任何她不喜欢的政权更迭（这些都成了灾难）——更不用说她入侵利比亚以及抛弃驻扎在班加西的美国人员。利比亚这些人员的丧生与克林顿直接相关，但他们家属的证词却被媒体拒之门外。 克林顿的行动鲁莽，直接导致了美国人的生命损失。而她极端的移民政策，正如克利夫兰美国受害者所指出的那样，将导致无数人死于本可避免的死亡，同时也使所有地方的所有居民面临更大的恐怖主义风险。正如伯尼·桑德斯多次所说，希拉里·克林顿“判断力差”。她没有资格担任总司令。

content.en: No group in America has been more harmed by Hillary Clinton's policies than African-Americans. If Hillary Clinton's goal was to inflict pain on the African-American community, she could not have done a better job. It's a disgrace. Tonight, I'm asking for the vote of every single African-American citizen in this country who wants to see a better future. The inner cities of our country have been run by the Democratic party for more than fifty years. Their policies have reduced only poverty, joblessness, failing schools and broken homes. It's time to hold Democratic politicians accountable for what they have done to these communities. At what point do we say, "enough?" It's time to hold failed leaders accountable for their results not just their empty words over and over again. Look at what the Democratic party has done to the city as an example and there are many others of Detroit: forty percent of Detroit's residents live in poverty. Half of all Detroit residents do not work and cannot work and can't get a job. Detroit tops the list of most dangerous cities in terms of violent crime. This is the legacy of the Democratic politicians who have run this city. This is the result of the policy agenda embraced by Hillary Clinton: thirty-three thousand emails gone. The only way to change results is to change leadership. We can never fix our problems by relying on the same politicians who created our problems in the first place. A new future requires brand new leadership. Look how much African-American communities suffered under Democratic control. To those I say the following: What do you have to lose by trying something new like Trump. What do you have to lose? I say it again, what do you have to lose. Look, what do you have to lose? You're living your poverty, your schools are no good, you have no jobs. Fifty-eight percent of your youth is unemployed? What the hell do you have to lose? And at the end of four years, I guarantee you, that I will get over ninety-five percent of the African-American vote. I promise you.
content.zh: 希拉里·克林顿的政策对美国没有任何一个群体的伤害比非裔美国人更大。如果希拉里·克林顿的目标是给非裔美国人社区带来痛苦，那么她做得再好不过了。这简直是耻辱。今晚，我请求这个国家每一位渴望看到更美好未来的非裔美国人投票。五十多年来，我们国家的内城区一直由民主党统治。他们的政策只减少了贫困、失业、学校教育的失败和家庭的破碎。现在是时候让民主党政客为他们对这些社区的所作所为负责了。我们什么时候才能说“够了”？是时候让失败的领导人为他们的工作成果负责，而不仅仅是他们一遍又一遍的空话。看看民主党对这座城市的所作所为，底特律还有很多其他的例子：40%的底特律居民生活在贫困之中。一半的底特律居民没有工作，无法工作，也找不到工作。底特律位居暴力犯罪最危险城市榜首。这是执掌这座城市的民主党政客留下的遗产。这是希拉里·克林顿推行的政策议程的后果：三万三千封电子邮件被盗。改变结果的唯一途径是更换领导层。我们永远无法依靠那些最初制造问题的政客来解决我们的问题。新的未来需要全新的领导层。看看非裔美国人社区在民主党控制下遭受了多少苦难。对于那些人，我想说：尝试像特朗普这样的新政客，你们会失去什么？你们会失去什么？我再说一遍，你们会失去什么。看看，你们会失去什么？你们生活在贫困中，你们的学校不好，你们没有工作。你们58%的年轻人失业了？你们到底会失去什么？四年后，我向你们保证，我将获得超过95%的非裔美国人的选票。我向你们保证。

We’re gonna straighten out our election process, too. That’s gotta be important also.
content.zh: 所以我们会处理好这件事，你和我。我跟你说，如果一切顺利，大家都能在1月5日或之前出来投票的话。你知道，以前投票都会有个日期。现在，你可以提前两个月，甚至三个月后投票。他们自己都不知道他们在干什么。但我们会把一切都理顺的。我们也会把这件事理顺的。我们也会理顺我们的选举程序。这也很重要。

from.en: Whoops! Trump Tells Supporters to Get Out and Vote on ‘January 5th’ Mediaite (October 14, 2024)
from.zh: 哎呀！特朗普在“1月5日”Mediaite节目中告诉支持者出去投票（2024年10月14日）

content.en: Now I want to take this opportunity to give you some advice. Over the course of your life, you will find that things are not always fair, you will find that things happen to you that you do not deserve, and that are not always warranted, but you have to put your head down, and FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT! Never ever ever give up, things will work out just fine. Look at the way I've been treated lately, especially by the media. No politician in history, and I say this is great surety, has been treated worse, more unfairly. You can't let them get you down, you can't let the critics, and the naysayers get in the way of your dream. I guess that's why I won, thank you. I guess that's why we won. Adversity makes you stronger, don't give in, don't back down, and never stop doing what you know is right. Nothing worth doing, ever ever ever came easy, and the more righteous you fight, the more opposition that you will face. I've accomplished a tremendous amount, in a very short time as president.
content.zh: 现在我想借此机会给你们一些建议。在你的人生历程中，你会发现事情并不总是公平的，你会发现有些事情发生在你身上，你不该承受，也并不总是有理可依，但你必须低下头，战斗！战斗！战斗！永不放弃，一切都会好起来的。看看我最近受到的待遇，尤其是媒体的报道。我可以肯定地说，历史上没有任何一位政客，比我受到的待遇更糟糕、更不公平。你不能让他们打击你，你不能让批评者和唱反调的人阻碍你的梦想。我想这就是我获胜的原因，谢谢。我想这就是我们获胜的原因。逆境使你更强大，不要屈服，不要退缩，永远不要停止做你认为正确的事情。没有什么值得做的事情是轻而易举的，你越是坚持正义，你面临的阻力就越大。我在担任总统的短短时间内取得了巨大的成就。
